intro: Illigera dunniana, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and woodland settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
